00037 #ifndef _MOUNT_UTILS_H_
00038 #define _MOUNT_UTILS_H_
00039 
00040 /* Some of the userland headers for libzfs also require
00041  * zfs/spl linux kernel headers, but including these pull
00042  * in linux kernel headers which conflicts with the
00043  * userland version of libcfs. So the solution is tell the
00044  * libzfs user land headrs that the zfs/spl kernel headers
00045  * are already included even if this is not the case.
00046  */
00047 #ifdef HAVE_ZFS_OSD
00048 #define _SPL_ZFS_H
00049 #define _SPL_SIGNAL_H
00050 #endif
00051 #include <ctype.h>
00052 #include <errno.h>
00053 #include <fcntl.h>
00054 #include <limits.h>
00055 #include <stdbool.h>
00056 #include <stdlib.h>
00057 #include <string.h>
00058 #include <sys/types.h>
00059 #include <sys/stat.h>
00060 
00061 #include <lustre_disk.h>
00062 #include <lustre_param.h>
00063 
00064 extern char *progname;
00065 extern int verbose;
00066 extern int failover;
00067 
00068 #define vprint(fmt, arg...) if (verbose > 0) printf(fmt, ##arg)
00069 #define verrprint(fmt, arg...) if (verbose >= 0) fprintf(stderr, fmt, ##arg)
00070 
00071 /* mo_flags */
00072 #define MO_IS_LOOP              0x01
00073 #define MO_FORCEFORMAT          0x02
00074 #define MO_FAILOVER             0x04
00075 #define MO_DRYRUN               0x08
00076 #define MO_QUOTA                0x10
00077 
00078 #define MAX_LOOP_DEVICES        16
00079 #define INDEX_UNASSIGNED        0xFFFF
00080 
00081 /* used to describe the options to format the lustre disk, not persistent */
00082 struct mkfs_opts {
00083         struct lustre_disk_data mo_ldd; /* to be written in MOUNT_DATA_FILE */
00084         char    mo_device[128];   /* disk device name */
00085         char    **mo_pool_vdevs;  /* list of pool vdevs */
00086         char    mo_loopdev[128];  /* in case a loop dev is needed */
00087         char    mo_mkfsopts[512]; /* options to the backing-store mkfs */
00088         char    *mo_mountopts;    /* mount options for backing fs */
00089         __u64   mo_device_kb;     /* in KB */
00090         int     mo_stripe_count;
00091         int     mo_flags;
00092         int     mo_mgs_failnodes;
00093 };
00094 
00095 /* used to describe the options to mount the lustre disk */
00096 struct mount_opts {
00097         struct lustre_disk_data  mo_ldd;
00098         char    *mo_orig_options;
00099         char    *mo_usource;            /* user-specified mount device */
00100         char    *mo_source;             /* our mount device name */
00101         char     mo_target[PATH_MAX];   /* mount directory */
00102         int      mo_nomtab;
00103         int      mo_fake;
00104         int      mo_force;
00105         int      mo_retry;
00106         int      mo_have_mgsnid;
00107         int      mo_md_stripe_cache_size;
00108         int      mo_nosvc;
00109 };
00110 
00111 int get_mountdata(char *, struct lustre_disk_data *);
00112 
00113 #define MT_STR(data)   mt_str((data)->ldd_mount_type)
00114 
00115 #undef IS_MDT
00116 #define IS_MDT(data)   ((data)->ldd_flags & LDD_F_SV_TYPE_MDT)
00117 #undef IS_OST
00118 #define IS_OST(data)   ((data)->ldd_flags & LDD_F_SV_TYPE_OST)
00119 #undef IS_MGS
00120 #define IS_MGS(data)  ((data)->ldd_flags & LDD_F_SV_TYPE_MGS)

00123 void fatal(void);
00124 int run_command_err(char *cmd, int cmdsz, char *error_msg);
00125 int run_command(char *cmd, int cmdsz);
00126 int add_param(char *buf, char *key, char *val);
00127 int append_param(char *buf, char *key, char *val, char sep);
00128 int get_param(char *buf, char *key, char **val);
00129 char *strscat(char *dst, char *src, int buflen);
00130 char *strscpy(char *dst, char *src, int buflen);
00131 int check_mtab_entry(char *spec1, char *spec2, char *mntpt, char *type);
00132 int update_mtab_entry(char *spec, char *mtpt, char *type, char *opts,
00133                       int flags, int freq, int pass);
00134 int update_utab_entry(struct mount_opts *mop);
00135 int check_mountfsoptions(char *mountopts, char *wanted_mountopts);
00136 void trim_mountfsoptions(char *s);
00137 __u64 get_device_size(char* device);

00139 /* loopback helper functions */
00140 int file_create(char *path, __u64 size);
00141 int loop_format(struct mkfs_opts *mop);
00142 int loop_setup(struct mkfs_opts *mop);
00143 int loop_cleanup(struct mkfs_opts *mop);

00145 /* generic target support */
00146 int osd_write_ldd(struct mkfs_opts *mop);
00147 int osd_read_ldd(char *dev, struct lustre_disk_data *ldd);
00148 int osd_is_lustre(char *dev, unsigned *mount_type);
00149 int osd_make_lustre(struct mkfs_opts *mop);
00150 int osd_prepare_lustre(struct mkfs_opts *mop,
00151                        char *wanted_mountopts, size_t len);
00152 int osd_fix_mountopts(struct mkfs_opts *mop, char *mountopts, size_t len);
00153 int osd_tune_lustre(char *dev, struct mount_opts *mop);
00154 int osd_label_lustre(struct mount_opts *mop);
00155 int osd_enable_quota(struct mkfs_opts *mop);
00156 int osd_init(void);
00157 void osd_fini(void);
00158 
00159 struct module_backfs_ops {
00160         int     (*init)(void);
00161         void    (*fini)(void);
00162         int     (*read_ldd)(char *ds,  struct lustre_disk_data *ldd);
00163         int     (*write_ldd)(struct mkfs_opts *mop);
00164         int     (*is_lustre)(char *dev, enum ldd_mount_type *mount_type);
00165         int     (*make_lustre)(struct mkfs_opts *mop);
00166         int     (*prepare_lustre)(struct mkfs_opts *mop,
00167                                   char *wanted_mountopts, size_t len);
00168         int     (*fix_mountopts)(struct mkfs_opts *mop,
00169                                  char *mountopts, size_t len);
00170         int     (*tune_lustre)(char *dev, struct mount_opts *mop);
00171         int     (*label_lustre)(struct mount_opts *mop);
00172         int     (*enable_quota)(struct mkfs_opts *mop);
00173         void   *dl_handle;
00174 };
00175 
00176 struct module_backfs_ops *load_backfs_module(enum ldd_mount_type mount_type);
00177 void unload_backfs_ops(struct module_backfs_ops *ops);
00178
